content.description: The steepest route so far at eagles rest. Start left of the bolt line. High tension boulder on solid rock gives way to basic hero jugs out the center of the cave.Â First and second ascent without kneepads. Way more fun than I thought it would be.
content.protection: 5 bolts. ground level bolt is to protect the belayer. Stick clip the next two. Gentler on the rope to climb to the anchors, unclip and downclimb or jump down to the last bolt. Currently has 3 fixed draws
content.location: ~100m up and left from the dream wall, climbs out the middle of a small cave perched above a pedestal. Watch your step. Gets full time shade.begin up solid white rock just left of the bolt line.

content.description: Start on the lowest point of the arete and move up good holds to an interesting, bouldery sequence to gain the ledge. Once on the ledge, continue upwards, following the chain draws (2) and another bolt to the anchor. Look for the holds, they're there. Highly recommended to use lowest bolt to protect the belayer and then stick clip the next two bolts to protect the low crux and keep yourself from decking. Note: There is a microwave size detached block wedged in an alcove about 8 feet right of the start. Do not step on this block. This route is also not great for top roping.
content.protection: 4 Draws. Two chain draws fixed on route. Anchors at top with rap rings.
content.location: Begins on the lowest point of the arete on the left side of the cave and heads up through a short, bouldery crux. Easily identified by mantle ledge above third bolt.

content.description: This small cave area is the furthest left area at Eagles, from the Dream Wall use established trails that trend up and left, you'll first pass Midgard and eventually reach the Cloud Deck. This small cave currently contains one mixed 5.8 route and two 12s.
